intro: Lepidophyllum phyliciforme var. resinosum, commonly known as the resinous lepidophyllum, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a low-growing, evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern California. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in a waxy, resinous coating. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
